Stem: Upright, widged with spiny wings and cobwebby appearance.
Leaves: Lance shaped with rounded and wider end in rosette. With cobwebby hairs, particularly underneath.
Flowers: Pinkish purple tubular cllustered flowerers in groups of 3-10, surrounded by green bracts and many spines.
FruitSeeds: Single-seeded dry, dull greyish-brown and grooved. Egg-shaped and with a tuft of unbranched parachuting hairs.
Habitat: Old gardens, pastures, coastal scrub, grasslands, open woodlands.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from very similar *Carduus pycnocephalus*(also known as Slender thistle) by generally having more individual flowers in the heads, which also have more cobwebby appearance.
